From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To set the process entry limit and the size of the history table for CPU utilization statistics, use the **process cpu statistics limit entry-percentage** command in global configuration mode. To disable CPU utilization statistics, use the **no** form of this command.
CLIs: process cpu statistics limit entry-percentage <number> [ size <seconds> ]
no process cpu statistics limit entry-percentage

ParaDef.Info: Integer from 1 to 100 that indicates the percentage of CPU utilization that a process must use to become part of the history table.
(Optional) Changes the duration of time in seconds for which CPU statistics are stored in the history table. Valid values are 5 to 86400. The default is 600.

Examples: The following example shows how to set an entry limit at 40 percent and a size of 300 seconds:
process cpu statistics limit entry-percentage 40 size 300
ExtraInfo: Use the **process cpu statistics limit entry-percentage** command to set the entry limit and size of CPU utilization statistics.

RelatedCmds.description: Defines CPU usage thresholds that, when crossed, cause a CPU threshold notification.
Specifies the recipient of SNMP notifications.
